basics.name: Xiaowei Ou
basics.label: Astronomer in training
basics.summary: A postdoctoral fellow at University of Virginia and NSF-Simons AI Institute for Cosmic Origins.

work.name: Department of Astronomy, University of Virginia
work.summary: Working on combining simulations and observations through synthetic surveys, and using machine learning to study the Galaxy.

recent publications.name: The dark matter profile of the Milky Way inferred from its circular velocity curve
recent publications.summary: For understanding the nature of dark matter (DM) on the MW scale, I studied the MW circular velocity curve to probe the Galaxy's potential and update the model of the DM density profile.

recent publications.name: Synthetic Gaia DR3 surveys from the FIRE cosmological simulations of Milky-Way-mass galaxies
recent publications.summary: Working with collaborators, I adapted the code base ananke to build a Gaia DR3 synthetic survey.

recent publications.name: Early r-process Enrichment and Hierarchical Assembly Across the Sagittarius Dwarf Galaxy
recent publications.summary: We established the existence of early r-process enrichment in the Sagittarius dwarf galaxy, and found that the galaxy is assembled with a non-negligible contribution from ultra-faint satellites.
